description:
In 2061 AD, Japan is dominated. Divided and ruled by the four major economic blocs of the world, the Japanese people spent their days oppressed as subjugated citizens. Japan became the front line of the world where AMAIM, a human-type special mobile weapon deployed by each economic zone, strode about.. One day, Amou Shiiba, a boy who loves machines, meets i-LeS (autonomous thinking AI) named "Gai," and this leads him to throw himself into the battle to reclaim Japan, by piloting the AMAIM "Kenbu" built by himself.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: เคียวไคเซ็นกิ สงครามจักรกล

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

node.description:
[Website](https://rasmusfaber.com/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/Rasmus_Faber) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rasmusfaber/)

Rasmus Faber is a music artist from Stockholm, Sweden. He is a pianist, DJ, remixer, composer, record producer, sound engineer and founder of the record label Farplane Records. He is mostly active in the electronic dance music genre, but also ventures into a wide variety of other musical styles. Rasmus performs solo as a DJ and pianist, and live with his band the RaFa Orchestra.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/151679259) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=1304769)

A freelance designer. He hasn't been active as an animator in over a decade.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

He made his full directorial debut with the release of [Honey and Clover II](https://anilist.co/anime/1142/Hachimitsu-to-Clover-II/) in 2006, after which he directed [Idolmaster: Xenoglossia](https://anilist.co/anime/1694/Idolmster-Xenoglossia/) in 2007, and [Toradora!](https://anilist.co/anime/4224/Toradora/) in 2008. He has also directed the spin-off series of [Toaru Majutsu no Index](https://anilist.co/anime/4654/Toaru-Majutsu-no-Index/), respectively named [Toaru Kagaku no Railgun](https://anilist.co/anime/6213/Toaru-Kagaku-no-Railgun/), which released in 2009.

Began his career at Ashi Productions. Leaving years later with [Nobuyoshi Habara](https://anilist.co/staff/115631/) and other Ashi staff to form [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/) in 1995.

During his time at Xebec, Ishihara would become one of the studio's most prolific and trusted animators, supervisors, and designers. He is best known for his adaptive designs for the [Rockman.EXE](https://anilist.co/anime/1710/) series. Other notable character design works include [Bakusou Kyoudai Let's & Go MAX](https://anilist.co/anime/2709/), [Dai-Guard](https://anilist.co/anime/1312/), [Daughters of Mnemosyne](https://anilist.co/anime/3342/), among others.

To this day he is well regarded by former Xebec staff. [Shingo Adachi](https://anilist.co/staff/110189/) recalls how it was Ishihara who had personally recruited him and led to him joining Xebec. [Kiyotaka Oshiyama](https://anilist.co/staff/119806/) said that Ishihara had helped him establish connections at [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/) early in his career when Ishihara invited him to take part in the first [Fullmetal Alchemist](https://anilist.co/anime/430/) film.
